intro: Disa obtusa subsp. obtusa, commonly known as the Broad-leaved Disa, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodland areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces a single, erect stem with several leaves and a cluster of flowers at the apex. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique appearance.
